1.description: Discover the untold stories of the heart of Africa. Where mist meets mountain, and silence speaks volumes.

2.description: Experience the pulse of the jungle and the serene beauty of our protected highlands.

3.description: Encounter gentle giants in their natural habitat. A profound connection with nature's rarest treasures.

4.description: Relax by the emerald waters of Lake Kivu. A paradise for relaxation, adventure, and reflection.

5.description: Feel the energy of Kigali. A city of innovation, art, and warm hospitality rising from the hills.

Testimonials.title: Traveler Stories
Testimonials.description: Real stories from real trips. See why thousands of adventurers choose Vizit Africa.

1.name: Sarah Mitchell
1.content: Vizit Africa made our gorilla trekking dream come true. The logistics were flawless, and our guide Jean-Pierre was incredibly knowledgeable. Highly recommended!

2.name: John Davis
2.content: I needed a quick car rental and hotel for a conference in Kigali. Their team arranged everything within hours. Professional, reliable, and excellent service.

3.name: Aisha Mohammed
3.content: Traveling with kids can be stressful, but Vizit Africa handled everything. The Lake Kivu resort they suggested was perfect for our family. We'll be back!

4.name: Marcus Chen
4.content: As a solo traveler, safety was my priority. Their local guides made me feel completely at ease while showing me hidden gems I'd never find on my own.

5.name: Emma Laurent
5.content: The golden hour at Akagera was magical. They knew exactly where to position us for the best shots. My portfolio has never looked better!

WhyUs.title: The Vizit Difference
WhyUs.description: We don't just book trips; we craft personal legacies. Here is what sets our journeys apart from the rest.
benefits: Local experts with deep Rwanda knowledge
Transparent costs with no hidden fees

FAQ.title: We Have Answers
FAQ.description: Everything you need to know about planning your unforgettable journey to Rwanda.
FAQ.cantFindMobile: Can't find what you're looking for?

1.question: How far in advance should I book?
1.answer: We recommend booking at least 3-4 weeks in advance, especially if you're planning gorilla trekking permits which can sell out months ahead. For peak season (June-September, December-February), book 2-3 months early.

2.question: What payment methods do you accept?
2.answer: We accept all major credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, American Express), bank transfers, and mobile money (MTN MoMo, Airtel Money). Payment plans are available for larger bookings.

3.question: Can I modify my booking after confirmation?
3.answer: Yes! You can modify most bookings up to 48 hours before your arrival date. Changes to gorilla permits are subject to availability and Rwanda Development Board policies.

4.question: Do you provide airport pickup?
4.answer: Absolutely. All our packages include the option for airport pickup at Kigali International Airport. Our drivers will meet you at arrivals with a name board.

5.question: What's included in the tour guide service?
5.answer: Our guides provide full-day services including transportation, entrance fees to attractions, meals, and expert commentary. They handle all logistics so you can focus on the experience.

6.question: Is Rwanda safe for tourists?
6.answer: Rwanda is one of the safest countries in Africa for tourists. Kigali is consistently ranked as one of the cleanest and most secure capital cities on the continent.

7.question: What should I pack for gorilla trekking?
7.answer: Essential items include: waterproof hiking boots, long pants, long-sleeved shirt, rain jacket, gardening gloves, and a daypack. We provide a detailed packing list upon booking.

8.question: Do I need a visa to visit Rwanda?
8.answer: Most nationalities can obtain a visa on arrival or e-visa. African Union passport holders and citizens of some countries enter visa-free. We'll help you understand your specific requirements.

CTA.title: Ready to
CTA.description: Escape the ordinary. We handle the logistics, permits, and luxury accommodations. You just show up and breathe.

Footer.tagline: Your trusted Rwanda travel partner. Professional planning for unforgettable African experiences.

About.title: The Vizit Story
About.intro2: We immerse. Vizit Africa was born from a simple yet radical belief: that travel should be more than sightseeing—it should be soul-stirring.
About.intro3: We strip away the artificial layers of tourism to reveal the raw, beating heart of Rwanda.
About.guidesDescription: Locals. Storytellers. Experts. Meet the people who know Rwanda best.

1.title: Respect
1.description: We honor the land, the wildlife, and the communities we visit. Every footprint we leave is mindful.

2.title: Authenticity
2.description: We don't stage experiences. We facilitate genuine connections with the real people and culture of Rwanda.

3.title: Impact
3.description: Tourism is a force for good. A portion of every journey goes directly to community upliftment.

4.title: Excellence
4.description: From the vehicle you ride in to the coffee you drink, we obsess over every detail of your journey.

the-retreat.title: The Retreat by Heaven
the-retreat.description: Kigali's premier luxury boutique hotel with solar-heated pools.

one-and-only.title: One&Only Gorilla's Nest
one-and-only.description: An exclusive front-row seat to the mountain gorillas.

kigali-soul.title: Kigali Soul Guesthouse
kigali-soul.description: A vibrant, artistic stay in the heart of Nyamirambo.

lavender-home.title: The Lavender Home
lavender-home.description: Cozy, family-run bed and breakfast near the convention center.

land-cruiser-v8.title: Toyota Land Cruiser V8
land-cruiser-v8.description: The ultimate safari vehicle for any terrain.

rav4-hire.title: Toyota RAV4 (New Model)
rav4-hire.description: Perfect for city driving and light off-road adventures.

guide-alex.title: Alex - Expert Birder
guide-alex.description: Specializing in the avian life of Akagera and Nyungwe.

guide-sarah.title: Sarah - Cultural Historian
guide-sarah.description: Unraveling the deep history and future of Kigali.

gorilla-trekking.title: Gorilla Trekking
gorilla-trekking.description: A once-in-a-lifetime encounter with the majestic mountain gorillas in their natural habitat. Trek through the misty forests of the Virunga volcanoes.

akagera-safari.title: Akagera Game Drive
akagera-safari.description: Spot the Big Five (Lions, Leopards, Rhinos, Elephants, Buffalos) in Rwanda's only savannah park. Enjoy boat trips on Lake Ihema.

nyungwe-canopy.title: Canopy Walk & Chimps
nyungwe-canopy.description: Walk 60 meters above the forest floor on the famous canopy walkway and track chimpanzees in one of Africa's oldest rainforests.

kigali-city-tour.title: Kigali Cultural Tour
kigali-city-tour.description: Explore the vibrant heart of Rwanda. Visit the Kigali Genocide Memorial, Kimironko Market, and art galleries to understand the country's past and present.

lake-kivu-relax.title: Lake Kivu Retreat
lake-kivu-relax.description: Unwind on the sandy shores of Lake Kivu. Enjoy boat rides, coffee tours, and stunning sunsets at this beautiful rift valley lake.

bisoke-hike.title: Mount Bisoke Hike
bisoke-hike.description: Challenging but rewarding hike to the summit of Mount Bisoke, featuring a beautiful crater lake at the top.

Gallery.title: Visual Stories
Gallery.description: A curated selection of moments captured across the Land of a Thousand Hills.

featured.title: Golden Plains of Akagera
featured.description: Where the savannah meets the sky. Witness the majestic Big Five in their natural habitat.

quote.text: In the heart of Africa, every landscape tells a story of resilience and beauty.
